articles.title: 'We really messed up' - does European football need more balance?
articles.summary: One set of clubs dominate the Champions League, another win their domestic title every year but cannot compete - does European football have a problem?

articles.title: Is facing a Champions League play-off really that bad?
articles.summary: The Champions League returns this week and some of Europe's biggest teams will be back in action a lot earlier than they would have hoped.

articles.title: Why Benfica tie is pivotal for Arbeloa and Real Madrid
articles.summary: After a difficult start as Real Madrid manager, Alvaro Arbeloa will know the importance of progressing past Jose Mourinho's Benfica in the Champions League play-off round.

articles.title: Own goal helps Brentford end Macclesfield's FA Cup run
articles.summary: Macclesfield's FA Cup dream ends in cruel fashion as Brentford win 1-0 after an own goal by Sam Heathcote.

articles.title: How well do you remember the league phase of the Champions League?
articles.summary: There was plenty of drama and high-profile clashes in this season's league phase stage of Europe's elite club competition.

articles.title: FA Cup heroes Macclesfield make memories to last a lifetime
articles.summary: Macclesfield's FA Cup odyssey may have ended against Brentford but they have made memories to last a lifetime, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

articles.title: League One Mansfield to host Arsenal in fifth round - full FA Cup draw
articles.summary: League One club Mansfield will host record 14-time winners Arsenal at Field Mill in the FA Cup fifth round, as Manchester City head to Newcastle in a repeat of the League Cup semi-final.

articles.title: Was Tullis-Joyce's 'tactical injury' a smart move? Fara thinks so
articles.summary: Fara Williams suggests that Phallon Tullis‑Joyce's 'tactical injury' was a clever move, as it gave Manchester United players the chance to receive instructions - guidance that subsequently contributed...

articles.title: 'Golazo!'- why one of football's most iconic intros has returned
articles.summary: BBC Sport looks at a feature of Serie A coverage which is delighting fans once more, three decades after the height of its popularity.

articles.title: Referee and assistant stood down after FA Cup mistakes
articles.summary: Referee Chris Kavanagh and his assistant Nick Greenhalgh have not been selected for a Premier League game this weekend.

articles.title: Is the Scottish title race the most exciting in Europe?
articles.summary: Can any other European league rival the drama of Scotland? BBC Sport has picked out the five closest title battles.

articles.title: Arrests made after discriminatory chants at Hull City
articles.summary: Arrests have been made following incidents of alleged discriminatory chanting during the FA Cup fourth round match between Hull City and Chelsea.

articles.title: What thrilling week tells us about Scottish Premiership title race
articles.summary: A super Sunday in the Scottish Premiership delivered thrills and spills and leaves the top three covered by just three points.

articles.title: Ramadan breaks to be used across English football again
articles.summary: Matches will briefly stop during a natural pause in play to allow Muslim players to break their fast - as has been the case since 2021 across English football.

articles.title: Wounded kings Real will be dangerous - Mourinho
articles.summary: Jose Mourinho warns his side that the "kings of the Champions League" will be dangerous after Benfica's dramatic win against Real Madrid last month.

highlights.title: Premier League highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: Wright hat-trick FIRES Coventry back to top of Championship!
articles.summary: Highlights of the Sky Bet Championship clash between Coventry City and Middlesbrough.

articles.title: 'Big players, big moments, big nights!' | Wright completes hat-trick from penalty spot
articles.summary: Haji Wright completed his hat-trick for Coventry City from the penalty spot to put the Sky Blues 3-1 ahead against Middlesbrough in their Sky Bet Championship clash.

articles.title: 'He should score!' | Wright heads against post for Coventry
articles.summary: Coventry's Haji Wright hit the post with a headed effort from six-yard out in the first two minutes of the Sky Bet Championship clash against Middlesbrough.

articles.title: Leeds beat Birmingham on penalties in FA Cup
articles.summary: Watch highlights as Leeds United hold their nerve to beat Championship oppponents Birmingham City 4-2 on penalties and reach the FA Cup fifth round.

articles.title: Did the water bottle help or hinder Leeds keeper Perri?
articles.summary: BBC Sport pundit Paul Robinson discusses Leeds United goalkeeper Lucas Perri's penalty shootout notes on his water bottle after the FA Cup win over Birmingham.

articles.title: Sunderland beat spirited Oxford in FA Cup
articles.summary: Watch highlights as Sunderland edge past Championship strugglers Oxford United to move into the FA Cup fifth round.
